intro: Zaluzianskya pumila, commonly known as the narrowleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pale blue to purple flowers. Its fruit is a small, globose berry that contains several seeds. Zaluzianskya pumila is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh conditions.
